meanings.definition: Crumping (verb): dancing in a style characterized by exaggerated movements and energetic gestures.
meanings.sent1: She was crumping enthusiastically at the dance competition.
meanings.sent2: The dancers crumped to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent3: The kids found joy in crumping together at the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like crumping wildly in her chest as she approached the stage.
meanings.sent5: The image of her crumping on stage stayed with the audience long after the performance ended.

meanings.definition: Crumping (adjective): relating to or characteristic of the dance style known as crumping.
meanings.sent1: The crumping moves of the dancers amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit had a crumping vibe that stood out on the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The crumping music filled the room with energy and excitement.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were alive with the crumping spirit of the festival.
meanings.sent5: The crumping culture brought a new wave of creativity to the dance scene.
